intro: Epidendrum dentiferum, commonly known as the toothed epidendrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its epiphytic growth habit, often found growing on trees in humid environments. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange with a contrasting purple or brown lip.
